headline: PennLive: Bartos Leads Republican Field in US Senate Race
author: WKOK Staff
sentences: Blake Marles, chairman of the Northeast Central Caucus, said his caucus chooses to rank candidates by the number of first, second and third place votes “to give these folks enough data so they understand where they fit in the pecking order right now and I don’t think a straw poll ranking does that.” He said the way the ranked vote turned out it shows there are quite a few viable candidates in that race noting Sen. Scott Martin of Lancaster County finished not too far behind White.

Bartos also proved to be state committee members’ favorite in the straw poll taken later Saturday by the Northeast Caucus that includes the northeastern counties of Bradford, Lackawanna, Luzerne, Monroe, Pike, Susquehanna, Tioga, Wayne and Wyoming counties.

Former congressman Lou Barletta of Luzerne County came away by far as the favorite in his home turf’s regional caucus straw poll while in the Northeast Central Caucus, Delaware County businessman Dave White scored the most first-place votes.

He emerged in Saturday’s straw poll with the most votes as the top-choice among the GOP state committee members from the four counties that make up the Northeast Central Caucus including Lehigh, Northampton, Carbon, and Schuylkill counties.

When all those first, second and third place votes were added together, Barletta came out on top in that ranked vote followed by GOP strategist and Quantum Communications CEO Charlie Gerow of Cumberland County and White came in third.

Bartos soundly came out on top in the Northeast Central Caucus’ ranked vote count among the Senate candidates with former hedge fund executive David McCormick of Allegheny County coming in a distant second.
HARRISBURG – PennLive is reporting… Montgomery County real estate developer Jeff Bartos continues to build on his lead in the crowded field of Republicans vying for the open U.S. Senate race.
But those straw poll results were more mixed when it came to the crowded field of gubernatorial candidates vying to take on presumed Democratic nominee Josh Shapiro in November.
However, the Northeast Central Caucus committee members don’t just take a straw poll.
They ranked their top three candidates.
